page.title: 06The Village School
page.content: The present village school was built in 1894. The children attending the Primary school today come mainly from the Norbury /Roston area, however the school also serves the nearby village of Snelston. Other pupils come from Ashbourne, Ellastone , Clifton and Stanton. The school is quite small, numbering some 50 children, so in order to encourage and provide a wider range of activities a mini bus has been purchased. This allows groups to be taken to other local schools for sporting events etc. The mini bus is used regularly for educational visits. The bus is shared by 4 schools. Visitors are always welcome to this very friendly and happy school.Many of the present day pupils parents came to this shool, one big happy family.
